New Records: Taylor Ward hit a solo home run in the bottom of the first inning.
Luke Raley hit a 437-foot solo home run in the top of the second inning.
Key Match Events: Anthony Rendon had the go-ahead hit with a two-RBI single in the bottom of the fifth inning.
Seattle left six runners on base and went 0-for-4 with runners in scoring position.
Pre-Game Insights: Mariners manager Dan Wilson noted the tough series and the team's performance in postgame comments.
Post-Match Reflections: The loss dropped Seattle to 69-68 and moved them six games behind the Houston Astros.
Wilson highlighted the team's resilience but acknowledged the tough loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mariners needed a series win or sweep to have a realistic chance for the postseason.
The article reflects on the team's season trajectory and the lack of luck.
